column5: I saw one reference to no onions crossing the border, along with worms, leeches, and potatoes. I haven't seen any other references to onions. We plan to shop at the new Safeway in Dryden, anyway, for potatoes, might as well pick up onions, too. Just curious. Anybody know the real scoop? Thanks. Heading up June 3rd from Wis. We usually have pretty smooth border crossings about 9AM Fridays.
They cost a dollar. If you don't think you can find them here, bring them along and see what happens.

Side note, we took night crawlers across in commercial bedding and customs let us through. They did ask what brand of commercial bedding however. Good thing I remembered Buss bedding and they let us pass.
The border gaurd said there is no problem bringing in onions. He thought maybe onion plants might be the issue
Onions were not on the border guards list when we went through I-Falls, I asked them.
[font color=green size=3][b]I went through at Fort Francis on the 19th and was asked about both potatoes and onions. So I guess it just luck of the draw.
I am going across the border with 2 lady friends, are you allowed to take tampons across?
